rows.text: Soils with high levels of organic carbon have all of the characteristics of a healthy soil that we have just discussed:
subtext_list: Have  good aggregate stability, hold lots of water and allow water to infiltrate easily
Supports large and diverse populations of microorganisms, which greatly  reduce the levels of soilborne plant parasites (including striga) and pathogens that destroy our crops roots
Is a reservoir of nutrients to support vigorous crop growth
